To copy the contents of another cell in LibreOffice Calc and remove all single quotes, you can use the following formula:
```
=REPLACE(A1,"'","")
```
This formula will replace all single quotes (`'`) with an empty string (`""`) in the contents of cell A1. The result will be the same as if you had copied the contents of another cell without any single quotes.

You can also use this formula to remove other characters, such as double quotes or backslashes, by replacing them with the appropriate character in the `REPLACE` function. For example:
```
=REPLACE(A1,"\"","")
```
This will replace all double quotes (`"`) with an empty string (`""`) in the contents of cell A1.

You can also use this formula to remove multiple characters by using a regular expression pattern, such as:
```
=REGEXREPLACE(A1,"['\"]","")
```
This will replace all single quotes (`'`) and double quotes (`"`) with an empty string (`""`) in the contents of cell A1.

It is important to note that this formula will only remove the characters you specify, it won't remove any other characters from the cell. If you want to remove all characters except for a specific set of characters, you can use the `REGEXREPLACE` function with a regular expression pattern that includes the characters you want to keep. For example:
```
=REGEXREPLACE(A1,"[^a-zA-Z0-9]","")
```
This will remove all characters except for letters and numbers from the contents of cell A1.
